vision.notes: Possess a single pair of compound eyes located on the head, beneath the carapace.

mechanoreception.notes: Numerous flattened legs along the abdomen likely used for detecting water currents and vibrations. Telson and caudal rami may also play a role.

chemoreception.notes: Likely important for detecting food and mates in their aquatic environment. Details are not explicitly mentioned in the provided text, but is common in crustaceans.
